intro: Comanthera euschemus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in racemes. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Comanthera euschemus is a valuable plant for pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies, due to its nectar-rich flowers.
